intro: Hoarea bijuga, commonly known as the twinleaf or false twinleaf, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its distinctive two-lobed leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, which are typical of the family. Hoarea bijuga typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodlands. It is often found in the southeastern United States, where it thrives in partial shade to full sun.
